embeds.title: Burning Touch
embeds.description:
Common Skill / 1 :energy_hexa: / The Hexaghost / Downfall

Apply 7 (11) **Soulburn** :p_soulburn:, twice if the enemy
has **Soulburn** :p_soulburn:.

messages.content: this is definitely one of hexaghosts cards but its draw dependent on a character who REALLY cares about their turn one (yes, more than normal which is a lot, hexa cares about it more)
the numbers on the card may look high, and they are high, but it's a draw dependent, delayed, conditional damage card.
I wouldn't take this unless you were absolutely unconcerned about attacks turn 1 vs nob so you don't take 20 extra damage for no reason and also weren't worried about sentries
it matches up terribly into gremlin leader, giant head, and reptomancer too.
it also has +1/+1 btw.
I would say that if you had no concern over act one elites or had Red Candle, go ahead. Otherwise look for attacks like firestarter, nightmare strike, and haunting echo.
the mere fact that this card is bad on turn 1 as well as 25% of your other turns holds it back a ton.

it also comes down to the fact that soulburn is often overkill damage, coming back to the idea that soulburn is, rather than true damage, lowering a required damage threshold that needs to be reached in your hallway and elite fights.
22 damage for 1. Screw the downsides this card is cracked
I might skip an unupgraded burning touch though
@Nic200
saying that 1 soulburn is equivalent to 1 damage is a lie
don't worry, already typing a paragraph
personally i'm more concerned about nemesis when using soul burn, since if the timing is off it just does nothing. At least ageist giant head you have time to stack it up.
sb is worth something like 1/2 to 2/3 of a damage
in terms of impact
soulburn matches up well into nemesis, you should be killing nemesis turn 4 anyways
if you aren't you're probably dead act 4 anyways

I find this card to be pretty high damage for 1 energy (when upgraded). This card is pretty bad unupgraded, but when upgraded this is a great way to make sure you have enough soulburn to kill most hallway fights on turn 3. The downside isn't negligible, but most of the time you should have soulburn going and usually the turn that your sb goes off you can already have more supplied. It does well into laga, alright into nob, but pretty poorly into sentries. I'd say it's alright into all the act 2 elites, it's weakest being gremlin leader as waiting sucks but as hexa you *should* be building around having ways to counter gremlin leader and repto. Speaking of repto, fuck repto. This card sucks going into repto. Not the best into head either, but it's useable. Ideally you'd take this in act 1 or 2 and it doesn't fall off too bad into late game, although there are better options if transitioning into late game is a higher priority for you.
and again, you should be trying to make your deck in a way that you always have two attacks turn one or are prepared to deal with not having drawn two attacks turn one every fight
~~maybe I should've made Nic200's Brainlets card a burning touch reprint/reference instead of an anti-defect 2 card~~
you don't always need to play 2 attacks turn one, you just need any source of soulburn.
then again, EVERYTHING soulburn does bad against sentries, so I think that can go without mention
you want two attacks turn one over having to manually apply soulburn 100% of the time
you kinda do for ghostflame wheel
i mean firestarter is pretty solid
you don't want to be wasting card plays.
unless you have the sneaky teakwood matchstick
sneaky is different
I think my anti-defect2 is a more prominent thing. Defect 2 appears in 1/5 of all runs, whereas burning touch only appears on hexa.
ok I should've said almost everything
why not waste card plays? Half of my hand is playing itself for free
not so with reworked hexa
wasting card plays means less wheel action.
no more ghost shield abuse
you want to be very efficient with your deck building when playing this character
Also afterlife is no longer full effect for 0 cost
i've yet to play the new hexaghost, currently I like burning touch for its raw value.
tbh i'm not efficient at all, I just see good card, click good card and good card wins game 🐒

Slight buff
I played 2 runs with new hexa about a month and a half ago, so a lot of what I'm saying is more based on old hexa tbh.
yeah it has +1/+1
I can get why it would be a good idea to play hexaghost intelligently though.
yeah this is me
wait so it's now 8(12)?
Yeah that seems fine, its similar to <bane> but arguably more useful since it has direct synergy with intensity (it pops that twice)
